RV03032-d-07-06-03-RVSC.Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train make-up
RV03032-d-07-06-03-RVSC.Narrative: CONDUCTOR PICKED UP TRACK 24  BEGAN PULLING THE TRAIN REAL SLOW BECAUSE THE GROUND WAS VERY SOFT DUETO PREVIOUS HEAVY RAINS AND THE TRACKS IN BAD SHAPE, PULLED OUT OF TRACK 24 OK AND BEGUN TO SHOVE THE TRAIN TOWARDS THE WEST YARD INTO TRACK 31 AT ABOUT 4 MPH.  THE TRAIN WAS MOVING NORMAL UNTILL  THE TRAIN BEGAN TO SLOW DOWN.  THE EMPLOYEE FELT  TRAIN SLOWING DOWN TO 2MPH AND ASKED THE CONDUCTOR IF EVERYTHING WAS ALRIGHT. CONDUCTOR REPLIED YES ENGINEER WENT AHEAD AND STOPPED THE TRAIN.  ENGR TOLD CONDR SOMETHING WAS WRONG CONDUCTOR CHECKED THE TRAIN AND NOTICED 4 CARS DERAILED.  RVSC NOTIFED THE UP CREW.  RVSC CREW TALKED TO UP MTO AT ABOUT 10:25AM.  MTO COMMENTED TO RVSC CREW THAT THE TRACKS WERE TOO WEAK DUE EXCESS RAINS AND IN POOR CONDITION.  UP SWITCHER HAD A DERAILMENT PRIOR TO OURSABOUT 50 YARDS FROM OURS.  THIS IS ENGR'S REPORT.  RVSC CREW HAD PULLED 30 CARS OUT OF TRACK 24 ANDWERE SHOVING THEM TO THE WEST YARD TO TRACK 31.  WHEN SHOVING BACK CONDUCTOR HAD TOLD ENGR. THAT THECARS WAS ENTERING TRACK 31. CONDUCTOR WAS WATCHING THE SHOVE, CONDUCTOR WAS FOLLOWING THE LAST CARON OUR TRAIN WHEN ENGR. ASKED CONDUCTOR IF EVERYTHING WAS OK CONDR. TOLD ENGR. YES BECAUSE THE LAST4 CARS THAT THE CONDR. SAW WAS STILL ON RAIL ENGR. TOLD CONDR. THAT SOMETHING WAS WRONG CONDUCTOR TURNED THE TRUCK AROUND AND SAW THAT 4 CARS WERE ON THE GROUND AT THE CURVE.  THIS IS CONDR'S REPORT.

192925-d-07-19-03-GTW.Narrative: M397-31-18 WAS MAKING A PICKUP OF 25 CARS FROM EJE GRIFFITH YARD.  CREW WAS SHOVING EASTWARD WITH 25CARS ON THE EJE SIDING AND ENTERED EJE MAIN #2 AT THE SHORT CROSSOVERS INSTEAD OF AT THE END OF THESIDING.  POINT WHERE CREW ENTERED MAIN#2 WAS TRACK WARRANT TERRITORY AND CREW DID NOT HAVE A TRACKWARRANT OR PERMISSION TO ENTER MAIN #2 OUTSIDE OF THE INTERLOCKING.  CREW WAS GIVEN PERMISSION PASTRED SIGNAL BY EJE DISPATCHER.  CREW THEN SHOVED THROUGH THE POWER SWITCH LEADING FROM THE SIDING TOMAIN #2 DAMAGING THE SWITCH.  DRUG USE WAS FOUND TO BE A CAUSAL FACTOR IN THIS INCIDENT.  ENGINEER WAS DISMISSED FROM SERVICE; CONDUCTOR WAS GIVEN REMEDIAL TRAINING .
